messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] food preferences
messages.msgSnippet: ... we call her little girl now.  She is a big girl! Except when she wants to be carried like a baby while nursing.  Oooooooooh my back! When my step-daughter
messages.messageBody:
> My 3 year old does this!
> I guess to a three year old 1 is kind of young.
> Lately she has taken to asking everyone when they were a baby. G-d forbid
we call her little girl now. She is a big girl! Except when she wants to be
carried like a baby while nursing. Oooooooooh my back!

When my step-daughter was about that age, she used to tell people, "I'm a
little bit little and a little bit big."
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] food preferences
messages.msgSnippet: I ve found that my food preferences changed with each pregnancy, and after each birth as well. Weird! Myranda [Non-text portions of this message have been
messages.messageBody:
I've found that my food preferences changed with each pregnancy, and after each birth as well. Weird!
Myranda




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] food preferences
messages.msgSnippet: My 3 year old does this! I guess to a three year old 1 is kind of young. Lately she has taken to asking everyone when they were a baby. G-d forbid we call her
messages.messageBody:
My 3 year old does this!
I guess to a three year old 1 is kind of young.
Lately she has taken to asking everyone when they were a baby. G-d forbid we call her little girl now. She is a big girl! Except when she wants to be carried like a baby while nursing. Oooooooooh my back!

be well,
Rachel Ann
----- Original Message -----
From: Alan & Brenda Leonard
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, October 20, 2002 6:12 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] food preferences


>
> We've always said "I didn't like that either when I was little, but when I
> was a teenager I did,"

It always cracks me up to her my 6 year old tell people, "I didn't like that
when I was little, but now I've come to like it."

I still think of him as little!

brenda
